results.title: My Colbo
results.brief_description: This film takes us on a tour of Colbinabbin and surrounds from the point of view of a number of locals. From the Old Cellar and Community Well to Chinaman’s Bend and Marian’s old family home that is covered in writings from the past, this story is full of historical facts and current realities. It also includes the story of the short-lived but successful Colbinabbin Tractor Pull and the once vibrant Lake Cooper which is now dry and has been for some years.

results.title: The McGillivray Family
results.creator_credit: Jonathon Hutchinson, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The story of the McGillivrays takes place in Gunbower on Saturday morning at the Gunbower Football Complex. This is a portrait of a family that has always worked the land, either as farmers or sheep shearers. They share their love of sports and concerns about the effects of the drought on small regional towns. All with a sense of humour and a never give up attitude that families need to survive in the current climate.

results.title: Gunbower: Family Albums
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: This film features life long residents of Gunbower and their family connections to three historically rich properties. From Greg Toll’s ancestral home in Kow Swamp to the Old Butter Factory in the heart of the town to Masters Landing on the shores of the Murray River. Each location resonates with childhood memories of times past.

results.title: Colbo Nights
results.creator_credit: Dean Lawry, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Football practice, barbequed snags and a couple of beers at the pub. This is Thursday night in Colbinabbin and you can meet local characters such as Slab, Meathead and Stewballs. The atmosphere is one of a close knit community that loves sports, live music and supports each other through good times and bad.

results.title: That mouse
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A white mouse cavorts about the forest, mostly on the back of a bumbling black bear, creating such a stir that other forest creatures (a deer, a tortoise, a hawk and a hound) have to put a stop to it. Children will enjoy the way the animals speak with human voices and act out their parts.

results.title: That midnight kiss
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: An opera singer (Kathryn Grayson) would like to have a tenor who looks the part of the tenor role. When Lanza, a singing truck driver is discovered, she gets her wish - and a happy ending isn’t far away. Cast also includes Jose Iturbi, Ethel Barrymore, Keenan Wynn, J. Carrol Naish, Thomas Gomez.

results.title: That eye, the sky [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Ruane, Grainne Marmion, Peter Beilby, Working Title Films and Entertainment Media
results.brief_description: When twelve-year-old Ort Flack’s father Sam is plunged into a coma after a truck accident, his family is fractured. As Ort’s mother bravely tries to hold her family together, a mysterious stranger appears and changes their lives - giving Ort courage, comfort and faith. This acclaimed adaptation of the novel by Tim Winton is about the healing power of love, about fantasy and faith, about a boy’s visions of the world beyond and about the blurry distinctions between the natural and the supernatural. Nominated for 9 AFI Awards and starring Peter Coyote, Lisa Harrow and Jamie Croft. Co-starring Amanda Douge, Mark Fairall and Alethea McGrath. Directed by John Ruane (Death in Brunswick), with music by David Bridie.

results.title: That's the price
results.creator_credit: Michael Scott, William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Two points of view concerning what the infusion of industrial capital meant to two dying coal towns in southeastern British Columbia. The film shows what happened when an American corporation came to the twin towns of Natal and Michel with a contract for millions of tons of coking coal for the steel mills of Japan. From what is seen and said in this film, industrial growth has its price, especially with regard to the ecology of the region.

results.title: That's surfing
results.brief_description: This comprehensive documentary looks at Australia’s long running love affair with the ocean and in particular, with surfing. The evolution of the modern surfboard is traced, as well as the emergence of surfing films, music, magazines and surfwear fashion industries. We see the surfboard manufacturing industries that have emerged in coastal towns such as Torquay where surfer-craftsmen experiment in their eternal quest for the perfect board. The development of the Australian surfing subculture is shown, from the influential U.S. surfers who arrived at the 1956 Olympic Games with their Malibu boards, to the female surfers in the 60’s who were largely disregarded unless they were tandem surfing with male partners. This culture is not only embraced by groups of mates who tour beaches in their panel vans but increasingly by the professional surfers who move around the world touring circuits from the Seychelles to Bali, and take out world titles in Hawaii. Historic clashes surfers have had with authorities are presented, as well as music clips of Australian surfing songs from Little Pattie, Col Joye, The Delltones, Normie Rowe and Johnny O’Keefe. The program is a blend of historical surfing footage, interview clips and cameo appearances from most of Australia’s surfing greats from the 1950’s through to the 1990’s including Midge Farrelly, Nat Young, Layne Beachley, Kelly Slater and Mark Occhilupo.

results.title: Malaysia: sparrow with sparrow, raven with raven
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the historical and cultural background of Malaysia. Religion and politics play an important part in the life style of the people. Suitable for secondary level.
